if you're a console fan, i'll second that recommendation for screen(1)
screen has a billion features, don't get bogged down in the socs ... detaching/attaching is the big one, then i use it for cut/paste too, the rest are less common
what you do is start a "terminal" inside screen, then run apps, then make more terminals if you want, etc
start irssi in console, get x working, detach, come back in x and reattach to that irssi, and no one on irc even knew you left, all /msgs saved, it's sweet
example,. detach from machine A, go to machine B and logon, and then attach to that machine, even though you never had it on that machine in the first place
there's a "kill" command too, but better to close things our properly :)
while at it, i'll also mention ^A^[ and ^A^]  are my friends too :)  (cut/paste)
always noce to give someone a new software toy, knowing there will be no productivity at the office for a week, lol
